snippet: A problem with wires in a defibrillator is the industry’s third highly visible safety episode in seven years, inviting discussion of a greater role for the F.D.A.
abstract: Widespread problems with implanted heart defibrillators made by St Jude Medical mark the third highly visible safety episode for the heart device industry in the last seven years, with Guidant and Medtronic having faced similar issues in which patients were killed or injured by flawed products; some experts believe St Jude was slow to warn doctors after they discovered the defect, which has caused several deaths worldwide.

byline.original: By BARRY MEIER and KATIE THOMAS

lead_paragraph: A problem with wires in a defibrillator is the industry’s third highly visible safety episode in seven years, inviting discussion of a greater role for the F.D.A.
